declarations.description:
A single, simple button, with optionally an icon.

```html
  <sl-button>Foo</sl-button>
```
declarations.name: Button

slots.description: Text label of the button. Optionally an sl-icon can be added
slots.name: default

members.name: fill
members.description: The fill of the button.

members.name: size
members.description: The size of the button.

members.name: type
members.description: The type of the button. Can be used to mimic the functionality of submit and reset buttons in native HTML buttons.

members.name: variant
members.description: The variant of the button.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: The fill of the button.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the button.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button. Can be used to mimic the functionality of submit and reset buttons in native HTML buttons.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The variant of the button.

declarations.description:
Checkbox group; treat a group of checkboxes as one form input with valitation, hints and errors

```html
  <sl-checkbox-group>
    <sl-checkbox>Option 1</sl-checkbox>
    <sl-checkbox>Option 2</sl-checkbox>
    <sl-checkbox>Option 3</sl-checkbox>
  </sl-checkbox-group>
```
declarations.name: CheckboxGroup

members.name: disabled
members.description: The hint disabled state.

members.name: form
members.description: Native form property

members.name: hint
members.description: The hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

members.name: hintSize
members.description: The hint size.

members.description: Name of the form control

members.name: validators
members.description: Custom validators.

declarations.description:
A checkbox with 3 states; unchecked, checked and intermediate.

```html
  <sl-checkbox>Foo</sl-checkbox>
```
declarations.name: Checkbox

slots.description: Text label of the checkbox. Technically there are no limits what can be put here; text, images, icons etc.
slots.name: default

members.name: change

declarations.description:
Groups buttons together in a bar separated by whitespace.

```html
<sl-button-bar>
  <sl-button>Foo</sl-button>
  <sl-button>Bar</sl-button>
</sl-button-bar>
```
declarations.name: ButtonBar

slots.description: Buttons to be grouped in the bar
slots.name: default

members.name: align
members.description:
The alignment of the buttons within the bar.
Functionally the same as flex-box alignments.

members.name: reverse
members.description: When set to true, the button order is reversed using flex-direction.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
The alignment of the buttons within the bar.
Functionally the same as flex-box alignments.

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: When set to true, the button order is reversed using flex-direction.

members.description: Add icon(s) to the icon registry

members.name: registerIcons
members.description:
Store all icons from the IconLibrary of the theme (icons.json) in the icon registry for easy access.
Is run in the setup method of each theme.

members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdate
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: columns
members.description: The nested columns in the group.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the group column is either manually specified, or the sum of the nested columns.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: mode
members.description:
The mode for the filter:
- `select`: The filter will allow you to select from a list of options. If none
are provided, the filter will create a list of options based on the column's values
- `text`: The filter will be a text input.

members.name: options
members.description:
The options you can choose from to filter. If not provided,
the filter will be a text input.

members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

attributes.name: auto-select
attributes.description: When true, the active rows get selected automatically.

attributes.name: select-all
attributes.description: When true, all items are selected.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

attributes.name: auto-width
attributes.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

attributes.name: grow
attributes.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: The label for the column header.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path to the value for this column.

attributes.name: parts
attributes.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

events.name: columnUpdate
events.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

methods.name: itemsChanged
methods.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

methods.name: stateChanged
methods.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

fields.name: renderer
fields.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

fields.name: scopedElements
fields.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

declarations.description:
Radio group; treat a group of radio button as one form input with valitation, hints and errors

```html
  <sl-radio-group>
    <sl-radio>Option 1</sl-radio>
    <sl-radio>Option 2</sl-radio>
    <sl-radio>Option 3</sl-radio>
  </sl-radio-group>
```

declarations.description:
A way to group together options, with or without heading.

```html
 <sl-select>
   <sl-select-option-group group-heading="Europ">
   <sl-select-option>Netherlands</sl-select-option>
   <sl-select-option>Spain</sl-select-option>
     <sl-select-option>Poland</sl-select-option>
   </sl-select-option-group>
 </sl-select>
```

declarations.name: camelize
declarations.description:
Returns the lowerCamelCase form of a string.

```javascript
camelize('innerHTML')          // 'innerHTML'
camelize('action_name')        // 'actionName'
camelize('css-class-name')     // 'cssClassName'
camelize('object.path.name')   // 'objectPathName'
camelize('my favorite items')  // 'myFavoriteItems'
camelize('My Favorite Items')  // 'myFavoriteItems'
```

declarations.name: capitalize
declarations.description:
Returns the Capitalized form of a string

```javascript
capitalize('innerHTML')         // 'InnerHTML'
capitalize('action_name')       // 'Action_name'
capitalize('css-class-name')    // 'Css-class-name'
capitalize('my favorite items') // 'My favorite items'
```

declarations.name: classify
declarations.description:
Returns the UpperCamelCase form of a string.

```javascript
classify('innerHTML')          // 'InnerHTML'
classify('action_name')        // 'ActionName'
classify('css-class-name')     // 'CssClassName'
classify('my favorite items')  // 'MyFavoriteItems'
```

declarations.name: dasherize
declarations.description:
Replaces underscores, spaces, or camelCase with dashes.

```javascript
dasherize('innerHTML')         // 'inner-html'
dasherize('action_name')       // 'action-name'
dasherize('css-class-name')    // 'css-class-name'
dasherize('my favorite items') // 'my-favorite-items'
```

declarations.name: decamelize
declarations.description:
Converts a camelized string into all lower case separated by underscores.

```javascript
decamelize('innerHTML')         // 'inner_html'
decamelize('action_name')       // 'action_name'
decamelize('css-class-name')    // 'css-class-name'
decamelize('my favorite items') // 'my favorite items'
```

declarations.name: humanize
declarations.description:
Returns the Humanized form of a string

```javascript
humanize('innerHTML')         // 'Inner html'
humanize('action_name')       // 'Action name'
humanize('css-class-name')    // 'Css class name'
humanize('my favorite items') // 'My favorite items'
```

declarations.name: underscore
declarations.description:
More general than decamelize. Returns the lower\_case\_and\_underscored
form of a string.

```javascript
underscore('innerHTML')          // 'inner_html'
underscore('action_name')        // 'action_name'
underscore('css-class-name')     // 'css_class_name'
underscore('my favorite items')  // 'my_favorite_items'
```

declarations.name: validationStyles
decorateProperty

parameters.description:
Optional finisher method; receives the element
constructor and property key as arguments and has no return value.
parameters.name: finisher

parameters.description:
Optional descriptor method; receives the
property key as an argument and returns a property descriptor to define for
the given property.
parameters.name: descriptor

declarations.description:
Helper for decorating a property that is compatible with both TypeScript
and Babel decorators. The optional `finisher` can be used to perform work on
the class. The optional `descriptor` should return a PropertyDescriptor
to install for the given property.
